DataElement.preferredName: Liver Size 0 Decimal Place Centimeter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric centimeter value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the liver size.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the size of a patient's or subject's liver.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The largest gland of the body, lying beneath the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium and upper part of the epigastrium; it is of irregular shape and weighs from 1 to 2 kg, or about 1/40 the weight of the body. It secretes the bile and is also of great importance in both carbohydrate and protein metabolism. SYN hepar.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Property.preferredDefinition: Size; the physical magnitude of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
